item.title: Seminar on large carnivores and statistical ecology
item.description:
A seminar I gave remotely for the university of Lisboa.

Statistical ecology 🌍📊, large carnivores 🐺🐻 and a pinch of social sciences 🤷, happy to share our research in this 45' talk 🤩🍾

slides: https://t.co/fKTMWko5J9
video: https://t.co/7KubqYJIBU pic.twitter.com/OJ292VWuel

— Olivier Gimenez 🖖 (@oaggimenez) December 10, 2020

item.title: Ecology meets linguistic
item.description: We organized a meeting between our lab and [Praxiling](http://www.praxiling.fr/?lang=en) a lab working in linguistic to explore potential collaborations between ecology and linguistic. Marie Chandelier and I gave a talk on our recent results on a content analysis we performed on wolf recovery in France and its coverage by newspapers. More soon on this front.

item.title: H. Smith's talk on detection dogs
item.description: As one of our always excellent department seminar, we had the chance to welcome Heath Smith from University of Washington, Center for Conservation Biology. Heath, together with his dog Chester with whom I became friend during the talk, is working with detection dogs on all sorts of important questions and organisms in conservation biology. Heath then headed to the Pyrénées with Nathalie Espuno to meet with our colleagues from the ONCFS bear (dream)team with whom we’re working on Blaise Piédallu’s PhD. They’re gonna try this technique there, no doubt the results will be of interest for our work on large carnivores!
